sn5.6:4.2: Then the nun Cālā got dressed in the morning …
sn5.6:4.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.6:4.4: The Māra the Wicked went up to Cālā
sn5.6:5.2: When you’re born, you get to enjoy sensual pleasures.
sn5.6:5.3: Who put this idea in your head:
sn5.6:6.1: “Death comes for those who are born,
sn5.6:6.2: When you’re born you undergo sufferings—
sn5.6:6.4: that’s why you shouldn’t approve of birth.
sn5.6:7.1: The Buddha taught me the Dhamma
sn5.6:7.4: he settled me in the truth.
sn5.6:8.1: There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
sn5.6:8.2: and others established in the formless.
sn5.6:8.4: they come back in future lives.”
sn5.6:9.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Cālā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
